creditline: Gift of Harold and Mickey Smith
description: bronze noisemaker with a Russian Cossack in a pillory chained to a tree
provenance: (Moriah Gallery, New York); Collection of Harold & Mickey Smith purchased 1978; Gift to the MIA in 1998
text: The Hebrew inscription on the top of this grogger translates, "Cursed be Haman, cursed be all the evil people." Here Haman is depicted as a Cossack, a group that carried out brutal pogroms against the Jews in Russia.
title: Grogger (noise maker)
